data.title: AAPL Stock Price, Company Overview & News
data.meta_description: Apple, Inc. engages in the design, manufacture, and sale of smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables and accessories, and other variety of related
data.text:
Who Is Ava Kris Tyson? MrBeast Co-Host Quits Popular YouTube Channel Amid Allegations Of Grooming

Ava Kris Tyson has worked on the MrBeast channel, YouTube's most popular, for over a decade.

Lions Are Strong No. 1 In Dangerous NFC North, But Competition Abounds

The NFC North appears to have risen to the top of the heap in the NFL. All four teams have a chance to develop into winners in the 2024 season.

Professors Attack Goodell’s Authority As Troubling Workplace Precedent

In the Brian Flores case, 12 law professors argue that permitting Goodell to serve as arbitrator “is unconscionable and contrary to the norms of fundamental fairness.”

Jamie Chadwick Sets Sights On The IndyCar Series In 2025

Jamie Chadwick, 26, is ready to take on the IndyCar Series after winning her first Indy NXT race in June. The three-time W Series champion, competes with Andretti Global.

Jannik Sinner—World’s No. 1 Tennis Player And Forbes 30 Under 30 Alum—Withdraws From Paris Olympics

Sinner became the first Italian tennis player to win a Grand Slam title earlier this year.

How To Watch Breaking At The 2024 Paris Olympics

With all 16 b-girls and 16 b-boys qualified, including four Team USA members, the stage is set for the history-making debut of breaking at the Olympic Games.

Trump’s Nephew Reportedly Claims He Used The N-Word, In New Book Promising Details Of ‘Darker Corner Of The Trump Empire’

Trump was also accused of using the racial slur by people who worked for him on “The Apprentice.”

Who Is Skipping Netanyahu’s Congress Address? Kamala Harris, Nancy Pelosi And Other Big Names

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is scheduled to address Congress at 2 p.m. EDT—though a number of lawmakers won’t be in attendance.

Humana To Open Clinics at Shuttered Former Walmart Health Sites

Humana plans to open senior-focused primary care centers at 23 former Walmart Health locations in Florida, Georgia, Missouri and Texas.

The Wild True Story Behind Netflix’s ‘Dirty Pop: The Boy Band Scam’ And Lou Pearlman’s Ponzi Scheme

Netflix's new docuseries focuses on Lou Pearlman, the conman who created the Backstreet Boys and scammed investors of at least $300 million. What happened in the case, and where is he now?

San Diego Comic-Con 2024: Hollywood Is Back, Baby!

With strikes and pandemics in the rear-view mirror, the world's wildest pop culture festival is ready to geek out in grand style.

JFK Airport Fire: At Least 9 Injured And Hundreds Evacuated—Here’s What To Know

The cause of the fire is under investigation, officials said.

Hottest Day On Earth: Planet Breaks Record Twice This Week Amid Historic Heat Waves

The European Union’s Copernicus Climate Change Service recorded the hottest day on Earth on Sunday, and then again on Monday.

Salt Lake City 2034: Winter Olympics Return To U.S. For First Time In 32 Years

Salt Lake City has been selected as the host city for the 2034 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games. It marks the first time the U.S. has hosted a Winter Games since 2002.

Meet America’s Best Employers For Women 2024

The 600 companies on this year's list champion gender pay equity, workplace flexibility and female leadership.
